channel.title: Simply Saucer – Lost In The Grooves

item.title: Gary Pig GoldÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Noughtie Twenty-One
item.dc:creator: garypiggold
item.description: Despite an alarming amount of critical mass to (and by) the contrary, there truly was much, much more worth hearing this decade just past than those big Big Star, Beatle, Bob Dylan and even Neil Young box sets. No, really! So then, strictly alphabetically speaking as always, hereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s what I spent much of January 1, … Continue reading "Gary Pig GoldÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Noughtie Twenty-One"
item.content:encoded:
Despite an alarming amount of critical mass to (and by) the contrary, there truly was much, much more worth hearing this decade just past than those big Big Star, Beatle, Bob Dylan and even Neil Young box sets.

No, really!

So then, strictly alphabetically speaking as always, hereÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s what I spent much of January 1, 2000 through December 31, 2009 listening very closely toÃ¢â‚¬Â¦..

 

Apartment – Sparkle Bicycle
Waikiki Record (2008)

Tatsuya NamaiÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s radiant pop of the Daniel Johnston-meets-Shonen Knife variety.

 

Alex Brennan – The Last Smile Of The Pied Piper
xtoalex@hotmail.com (2004)

Hopefully Mr. Brennan will be duly hired to give the Beach BoysÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ catalog that Beatles Love treatment when the time inevitably arrives.

 

Lindsey Buckingham – Under The Skin
Reprise Records (2006)

Once insane, always insane.

 

Candypants – Candypants
Sympathy For The Record Industry (2000)

Ronnie Spector fronts ElvisÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ Attractions Ã¢â‚¬Â¦and THEN some!

 

Casper and the Cookies – The OptimistÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Club
Happy Happy Birthday To Me Records (2006)

What Jason NeSmith and Kay Stanton did on their holidays in New York City.

 

Cheap Trick – Rockford
Big3 Records (2006)

Remarkably sounding better Ã¢â‚¬â€œ and louder Ã¢â‚¬â€œ than ever.

 

Dennis Diken with Bell Sound – Late Music
Cryptovision Records (2009)

The album Brian Wilson has been trying to make since at least 1986.

 

Johnny Dowd – Wire Flowers: More Songs from the Wrong Side of Memphis
Munich Records (2003)

A sonic sequel to one of the NinetiesÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ undeniably greatest albums Ã¢â‚¬Â¦and artists.

 

Bob Dylan – Modern Times
Sony/BMG Music Entertainment (2006)

Edges out Christmas In The Heart by a mere Santa whisker.

 

Electric Prunes – Feedback
PruneTwang (2006)

Proving you can have your re-heated soufflÃƒÂ© and eat it, too.

 

Tom Jones – Mr. Jones
V2 Music (2003)

Wherein Atomic Jones meets Wyclef Jean Ã¢â‚¬Â¦by way of Ã¢â‚¬Å“Black BettyÃ¢â‚¬Â !

 

Bill Lloyd – Back To Even
New Boss Sounds (2004)

Fifteen more examples of most potently powerful pop, Nashville-style.

 

Lolas – Like The Sun
Jam Recordings (2007)

Tim Boykin and his ever-bright l-o-l-a Lolas honestly do make the kind of records you still think Paul McCartney does.

 

Jack Pedler – Jack Pedler
Race Records (2001)

The sound of the hardest-working drummer in Canada loading all six strings.

 

The Playmates – Sad Refrain
K.O.G.A. Records (2002)

Forever more than happy to play the Stones against their countrywomen Puffy (AmiYumi)Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s Beatles.

 

RaquelÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Boys – Music For The Girl You Love
Jam Recordings (2004)

Just as if Bobby Fuller and those once FlaminÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ Groovies were never ever extinguished.

 

Jason Ringenberg – A Day At The Farm with Farmer Jason
Yep Roc Records (2003)

The definitive alternative to alternative country.

 

Simply Saucer – Cyborgs Revisited
Sonic Unyon Recording Company (2003)

The nice, nice noise that simply continues to keep on giving.

 

Frank Lee Sprague – Merseybeat
Wichita Falls Records (2005)

Exactly as if Brian Epstein had never entered The Cavern.

 

Tan Sleeve – White Lie Castle
Cheft Worldwide (2000)

Wherein George Harrison and even F. Zappa receive the Bacharach and David by way of Todd Rundgren treatment.

 

Teenage Head – Teenage Head with Marky Ramone
Sonic Unyon Recording Company (2008)

CanadaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Ramones finally reunited with their very-long-lost brudder.

 

 

now,

Bring On the Twenty-Oh-Teens !!!

item.title: Gary in Medleyville
item.dc:creator: garypiggold
item.description: Whilst continuing to faithfully remain Lost In The Grooveall summer long, your resident Pig has consentedto scribble monthly,right over there atMedleyville Dot USas well. so then,If youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re ever wondering why Bob was Judas, when Simply Saucer turned Half Human, who That Lucky Old Sun is still shining upon, where you should buy Your First Punk … Continue reading "Gary in Medleyville"
item.content:encoded:
Whilst continuing to faithfully remain
Lost In The Groove
all summer long,

your resident Pig has consented
to scribble monthly,
right over there at
Medleyville Dot US
as well.

so then,
If youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re ever wondering

why Bob was Judas,

when Simply Saucer turned Half Human,

who That Lucky Old Sun is still shining upon,

where you should buy Your First Punk Rock Record,

and even How much those Rolling Stones just got out of
the Universal Music Group,

(plus Pat Boone to boot),

feel more than free to get Lost
in that Medleyville Groove,
as autumn falls all around us

(Ã¢â‚¬Â¦making sure to tell Ã¢â‚¬Ëœem
Gary Pig Gold sentcha,
of course !! )

Just be sure to … Continue reading "Simply Saucer"
item.content:encoded:
As stated before,

Hamilton, Ontario, CanadaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s
one and only
Beefheart/Seeds/Floyd/Velvets-even
uber-amalgamation
(aka Simply Saucer)

have recently reformed, relaunched,
recorded and now actually released
their first Ã¢â‚¬Å“officialÃ¢â‚¬Â album in, oh,
say three-and-a-half-decades or so,
give or take.

and
Said sounds can now be streamed,
sampled,
purchased,
and/or experienced fully live

by any and all
willing to leave preconceptions,
not to mention pigeonholes,
firmly in the half past.

Just be sure to tell Ã¢â‚¬Ëœem
Gary Pig sentcha….

item.title: It Was Thirty Years Ago TODAY !!

item.description: Those Were The Daze,indeed, when you couldread all about The Sex Pistols Loved Ones Simply Saucer Dennis Wilson and even thoseRamone Brothers all in one placeall at one time, and All for onlyOne Thin Dollar(Canadian) !!

Those
Were The Daze,
indeed,

when you could
read all about

and even those
Ramone Brothers

all in one place

Even gotto appear in an up-coming documentaryon The Little Band That Couldto boot ! Much More Newsto … Continue reading "Simply Gary"
item.content:encoded:
On my latest scarred trek back
to The Most Musical Town in All of O Canada,

I fortunately found myself
right there in the studio audience
as none other than Simply Saucer
laid tracks towards
their first Ã¢â‚¬Å“newÃ¢â‚¬Â album in, well,
thirty-some-odd years.

Even got
to appear in an up-coming documentary
on The Little Band That Could
to boot !

Much More News
to come,

so
Stay Completely Tuned,
lost grooversÃ¢â‚¬Â¦..
